user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 is: A function parameter should not be modified.
Note that the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified, but the pointer itself shall not be modified.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_run_noblock:
```c
int metal_run_noblock(int threads, metal_thread_t child,
		     void *arg, void *tids, int *threads_out)
{
	int error, i;
	pthread_t *tid_p = (pthread_t *)tids;

	if (!tids) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "invalid argument, tids is NULL.\n");
		return -EINVAL;
	}

	error = 0;
	for (i = 0; i < threads; i++) {
		error = -pthread_create(&tid_p[i], NULL, child, arg);
		if (error) {
			metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "failed to create thread - %s\n",
				  strerror(error));
			break;
		}
	}

	*threads_out = i;
	return error;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function metal_run_noblock:
typedef void *(*metal_thread_t)(void *)
...
#define metal_log(level, fmt, __VA_ARGS__) ({if(_metal.common.log_handler&&level<=_metal.common.log_level)_metal.common.log_handler(level,metal_fmt(fmt),##__VA_ARGS__);\
})
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
No function parameter is modified in the shown code. Analysis by parameter:
- threads (int): only read in the for loop condition; never assigned to.
- child (metal_thread_t): passed to pthread_create but not assigned or altered.
- arg (void *): passed to pthread_create but not assigned or altered.
- tids (void *): tested for NULL and then cast to a local pointer (tid_p). The code never assigns to the tids parameter itself; only the objects pointed into by tid_p (which reference caller-provided storage) are written by pthread_create — this is permitted by the rule (the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified). 
- threads_out (int *): the function writes *threads_out = i; this modifies the object pointed to by the pointer parameter, which is allowed by the rule. 
Other operations (e.g., assigning to local variable error, using the metal_log macro) do not modify any of the function parameters themselves. Therefore there are no MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 violations to report in this function.
